title: Great. Marvellous. Slendid

Androids permissions aren't fine grained enough on one hand and Andlytics needs account access to actually grab den dev console data for your apps stats.

title: Plz use server timestamps & dates
comment: Love the app, just needs 1 change. Please rely on server dates from Google and do not zero out Downloads / Active installs, just show previous day if no data for today.

title: Do rely on local time / Change hard to guess

I have to check each manually which sucks.

title: Fork the source and compile locally
comment: Issues need to be submitted on Github, followed by common sense troubleshooting, leading up to retrieving the logs yourself. It's easier to fork the source, verify, and correct your own issue if it is still relevant in that version.

Would you mind opening an issue on github for the admob problem? Seems to work for other users so its isn't completely broken - https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/issues - Replying to comments + auto translations will be part of 2.5.0 most likely released next week, we are just waiting for some translations...

title: Should not auto refresh when you open the app every time
comment: I have over 300 apps and the time to refresh stats is almost 20 minute. As soon as the stats come up the refresh starts again in a few seconds. A way to refresh only on demand would be great. Or may be cancel ongoing refresh. Because when the main stats are refreshing I can't see comments.  Thanks for the reply below. But, I cant find a way to set the interval. It only allows me to set an interval for autosync. But everytime i load it still starts refreshing. Am i missing something? Please guide me as to wh
There is only the interval setting. I will open an issue on Github for this matter.

title: New admob button not working?
comment: Updated to 2.6   , nice improvements, but I'm getting an unexpected error when selecting the "new admob" tab. I choose my account, I enter my admob password and then fails. Is there an api key or something in my new admob account?
There is no password for the new Admob, it uses your Google account to login. Post on the G+ community or Github for further assistance.

title: Full account access
comment: Have been using this app for the past year and I was very satisfied with it. I'm concerned about the need for full account access. Why do you need full access too my account?

Google does not have a way to just request access to the Developer Console, so the app has to ask for everything. It has always been this way, it just wasn't obvious from the tokens the app requested previously. As the app is on Github you are free to check the code for yourself to see how the app uses the token.

title: Full account access?
comment: Ummmm...  Yeah....pass.  You expect to be granted full account access to our dev console accounts?  You make this change and state in the change log that there will be no further updates...sounds shady.

All new features are going to the 2.6-alpha version which is available on Google Play. As for account access, the previous version was the same, only with a less obvious message. The whole thing is open source, of course.

title: Keeps requesting authentication
comment: I really like this app but the last update made it fail when getting my data. It keeps asking for authentication even though I have clicked on the notification three or more times. After that, it says there are no apps to show even though I have three apps on the play store. I'll change my rating when the problems are fixed. ------- Thank you for the quick fix, I've changed my rating to 4 stars. I still have a 'bug report' to do: I have apps with more than 4500 comments, but for some reason, Andlytics stopped counting them when it got to 4500. Can you fix that? Congratulations for the great work this is the only app for managing my development projects - excellent app!
We might be able to come up with a fix but will most likely need your help with that regard information like logcats. Please reach out to us on Github so we can find a solution for this issue.

title: A Great App!
comment: This really is a great app, made by droid developers for droid developers! Really easy way to keep track of your app(s) success (or failure!). Only thing that would make it better at the moment would be a comment reply feature for those developers that can reply! No sooner than I ask for comment reply then that add it! Again I say,  great app!
Hi James, version 2.5.0+ includes comment replies for enabled accounts. See the arrow at the top right of each comment.

title: Works great
comment: Occasionally stops working but the Devs are on top of website changes to keep it up to date.

Hi Kyle, did you try the latest release 2.4.3? You probably need to logout and login again on the developer console since Google might require you to confirm your phone number which blocks Andlytics from logging in.

title: Great App!
comment: Sorry about the lingering 1-star. The bug was fixed with API update over a month ago, lol. This app is great! If I could make a suggestion (if the API allows it) is to simply import all the history. I'd hate to lose my statistics if I move to a new phone.

Hi Jase,
we support export and import (see left bottom), you can share it to your dropbox app and then import it via the dropbox app on the new phone (click on the Zip and choose Andlytics to open it). Drop us an email if you need more detailed informations.

title: Nice app

title: Incredible App - Easily See Stats
comment: As a developer with a few applications in the Play Store, this app is absolutely invaluable to me. It also allows me to see my Admob revenue right in the app and disable the apps that don't have it.  The developer is always super quick to fix API issues, usually within a day or two.  I recommend this app to anyone developing in the Play Store and who wants to have a quick view into how well their app is doing!

title: Brilliant!!! Android Developer Must have.
comment: The app save me a lot of time by showing gain/loss on different figures. It even betting then the official AdMob and Developer Console becuase it indicate the changes of different figures. I do not need to go to Developer Console + AdMob everyday for calculate the trend manually.  This is already a 5 stars app. BUT, it would be nice if adding the Google Checkout also then we (Android Developer) could see how much we earned, then i would said this is perfect and i would like to donate/paid too.  -- Destiny Workshop

title: Good overall but...
comment: I accidentally associated the wrong admob data with one of my apps. I cannot remove admob from the app now to fix the issue. I get a toast saying that there was a problem and it has been reported. The app then locks up and I have to force close it via a task manager.  In the meantime, the workaround I used was exporting all of my app data via the export button on the main screen. I then cleared the andlytics data via android settings. I was able to then reassociate the admob app properly and import the data

Hi Jeffrey, would you mind opening an issue on Github and provide some more details there so we can come up with a solution to fix the problem described in your comment? https://github.com/AndlyticsProject/andlytics/issues
